The Real Issue: The Warriors have been trying to keep the dynasty alive with an outdated system, a mismatched roster, declining veterans, weak defensive coaching, a front office that’s too sentimental. Steph is still elite — but the infrastructure around him is not. Fix the architects. Fix the builders Then fix the roster.

text: Revisionist history is crazy. Draymond Vetoed the trade 2 years ago. At the time Lauri averaged 23-8-6. It would have cost them kuminga who in his third season was averaging 16-5-2, moody who was a lottery pick in his second season, podz another young player, and 6-8 first round picks (unprotected and swaps). Every single GM said the Jazz has no real intention of trading markkanen with the asking price for him at the time. This was also before the Jimmy trade. So in the warriors eyes they were able to trade for a guy averaging 17-5-5 who’s a much better defender than Lauri while still keeping half the picks they would’ve traded away AND they were able to hold on to their two young lottery picks. The young players aren’t working out quite as well as the warriors would hope and butler is old now but it’s not a guarantee that curry, dray, markkanen and a bunch of minimum guys would be better than the current warriors roster anyways that still has assets to grab another player
